data.title: Hasso Plattner Institute near Berlin offers new Master in Computer Science
data.meta_description: A new English Master’s program with no tuition fees, excellent industry and research integration and latest IT topics: M. Sc. Computer Science in Potsdam, Germany.
data.text:
The Hasso Plattner Institute (HPI) offers a new Master of Science in Computer Science, designed for those with a relevant bachelor’s degree seeking advanced IT knowledge and skills. The program emphasizes both theoretical foundations and practical applications, covering topics like data engineering, cybersecurity, artificial intelligence, algorithms and digital health. Students can choose the IT track that suits them most.

HPI is part of the public University of Potsdam and is located just minutes from Berlin. All students benefit from top-notch facilities, excellent connections to the world of tech and IT, and do not have to pay any tuition fees.

Key features of the Master’s program in Computer Science include industry and research collaborations that provide students with real-life project experience and insights into the latest trends and technologies. For example, students have the opportunity to collaborate on a combined project between MIT and HPI and undertake a research stay in Boston.

The curriculum integrates soft skills development in project management, leadership, and communication, ensuring graduates are well-prepared for diverse career paths. The program’s flexible structure allows students to tailor their studies to their interests and career goals.

HPI’s Master in Computer Science provides a comprehensive education blending theory and practice, equipping students for successful careers in academia, industry, or entrepreneurship.

Computer Science is taught in English, has a standard period of study of 4 semesters and starts in winter and in summer semester. Application deadlines are June 1 and December 1 and scholarships for international students are available every year.
